ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: In a typical week how many hours do you spend using the internet?
Notes: 1= None; 2= Less than 7 hours; 3= 7-14 hours; 4= 15-20 hours; 5= 21 or more hours

ElementDescription: Have you ever tried to cut back on your Internet use?
Has a family member ever expressed concern about the amount of time you use the Internet?
Have you ever missed school, work, or an important social activity because you were using the Internet?
Do you think you have a problem with excessive internet use?
Have you ever experienced an irresistible urge or uncontrollable need to use the Internet?
Have you ever experienced a growing tension or anxiety that can be relieved only by using the Internet?
Problematic Internet use (positive endorsement of #3 urge, #4 growing tension, and #6 cut back)
How much time in a typical week do you spend on the Internet doing the following activities: Social Networking (for example, using Facebook)
Notes: 1= None; 2= Less than 7 hours; 3= 7-14 hours; 4= 15-20 hours; 5= 21 or more hours

Notes: 1= None; 2= Less than 7 hours; 3= 7-14 hours; 4= 15-20 hours; 5= 21 or more hours

Notes: 1= None; 2= Less than 7 hours; 3= 7-14 hours; 4= 15-20 hours; 5= 21 or more hours

Notes: 1= None; 2= Less than 7 hours; 3= 7-14 hours; 4= 15-20 hours; 5= 21 or more hours

ElementDescription: How much time in a typical week do you spend on the Internet doing the following activities: Doing Work

ElementDescription: How much time in a typical week do you spend on the Internet doing the following activities: Information Gathering (for example, searching on Google or reading news)
Notes: 1= None; 2= Less than 7 hours; 3= 7-14 hours; 4= 15-20 hours; 5= 21 or more hours

ElementDescription: How much time in a typical week do you spend on the Internet doing the following activities: Dating or Hooking Up (for example, using eHarmony or Tinder)
Notes: 1= None; 2= Less than 7 hours; 3= 7-14 hours; 4= 15-20 hours; 5= 21 or more hours

Notes: 1= None; 2= Less than 7 hours; 3= 7-14 hours; 4= 15-20 hours; 5= 21 or more hours

ElementDescription: How much time in a typical week do you spend on the Internet doing the following activities: Other (specify)
Have you ever smoked a cigarette? (Lifetime)
Ever smoked marijuana?

I want to start by asking if you have EVER TRIED any of the following drugs in your life. Have you ever tried___________at any time in your life? A sip of alcohol such as beer, wine or liquor (rum, vodka, gin, whiskey)
Have you ever had a drink of alcohol, other than a few sips?
Notes: 0= No; 1= Yes; 98= Do not know; 99= Refused

ElementDescription: How frequently have you used alchohol over the last 30 days?
Have you ever used designer or other drugs, such as Ecstacy, GHB, Special K, cocaine, methamphetamine, and heroin? (Lifetime)
How much caffiene do you use daily?
Notes: 0= None; 1= 1-2 drinks per day; 2= 3 or more drinks per day

ElementDescription: During the past 12 months, did you ever feel so sad or hopeless almost every day for two weeks or more in a row that you stopped doing some usual activites?
Are you: African American or Black?
Are you: Caucasian or White?
Are you: Asian?
Are you: Hispanic or Latino?
Are you: Other?
Family structure
Adolescent's current grade in school (If between grades, e.g., summer vacation, circle last gradecompleted) (If not currently in school, use Code 19.)
Notes: 5=5th grade; 6=6th grade; 7=7th grade; 8=8th grade; 9=9th grade; 10=10th grade; 11=11th grade; 12=12th grade or 1st year CEGEP in Canada; 13=1st year college/university/community college (or 2nd year CEGEP in Canada); 14=2nd year college/university/community college; 15=3rd year college/university/community college; 16=4th year or more college/university/community college; 17=Technical/trade/vocational school (e.g. auto mechanic or computer technician school); 18=Un-graded Special Education classroom; 19=Not in middle school, not in high school, not in college, and not in technical school

ElementDescription: Grade average
Notes: 1= As and Bs; 2= Cs; 3= Ds and Fs
